noun.description: A localized thickening of the ectoderm in a vertebrate embryo which contributes to the formation of a sensory organ, ganglion, feather or scale, etc.

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Science. From German Plakode from ancient Greek πλακώδης laminated, flaky from πλακ-, πλάξ flat plate + -ώδης.
